page.title: 03FARMING AT STOKE ON TERN
page.content: {POULTRY FARMS { One of the most common types of farms in this area is a poultry farm. A typical poultry farm could have 84,000 hens, 28,000 to a shed.They lay 60,000 eggs a day. The farmer may sell his eggs himself or have them packed for a firm and sent off. Two breeds of hen are used: Ross Brown and Warren.They say Warren lay better than Ross Brown and lay more.Before the hens can go into the poultry farm they have to be injected to stop them from getting diseases. Each hen has to be done one at a time 3 times a month.This to just over 3,000 hens,it is a horrible job. The hens are fed on laying ration which gives them the correct amount of elements. Each hen spends its life cooped up inside a small cage.
